Michael Scharf wrote:

> I am surprised that etags/date and keep-alive
> are not part of the archive.org crawler. Couldn't that
> reduce the overall amount of spidered pages and
> therefore being more polite?
>
It could lessen the load we put on remote servers.

> I'd be interested in the HTTP/1.1 patches.
> If I would get it to work, I'd like to
> contribute it back.

Ok (I've asked the original author if its ok to post his patch).

Also, in '[ 1254577 ] Why copy HttpConnection? use 
SocketDecoratorProtocolFactory', you suggest an interesting way of doing 
the socket stream wrap (Why did you close the issue? And I don't 
understand your last comment). Since we have protocol factories in place 
anyways, all the more reason to do as you suggest.  I'm trying out your 
suggestion here locally.

Yours,
St.Ack

>
> Michael
